COMMUTERS' SERVICE—Many men of affairs now
make their daily trip to their waterside country homes,
or to their golf courses, in the luxurious cabin of an Aero-
marine Flying Boat. It is speedy and comfortable. What
used to be an hour of grime and land turmoil, coupled
with traffic holdups and other vexatious delays, is now
twenty feeting minutes of safe, restful pastime.
For many business men who spend their summers along
Long Island Sound or the New England or New Jersey
coast resorts, or along the shores of the Hudson, we have
established a
commuters' service at reasonable cost.
From points as distant as 100 or 150 miles from New
York City we can carry business men to their offices in
the morning, and to their homes at night in one-fourth
the time heretofore required.

The types of boats used by the Aeromarine Airways have been flown by the U.S. Navy hundreds of thousands of miles.
Due to the carefully designed character of their hulls, their seaworthiness is proverbial. Thousands of passengers have been
aloft in this type of boat and there has never been an accident. They have

COST OF FLYING-The cost for trips is far less
than is charged for air travel in any other part of the
United States. The Passenger Department is ready at
any time to quote rates for sightseeing or to any special
points along the waterwavs or the casc Tor singie pas
sengers or parties. Open and enclosed Flying Boats may
be chartered for exclusive parties for short flights or for
all-day use, or for a week or longer on favorable terms.
The enclosed cabin boat has seating capacity for eleven
Forward cabin contains six wicker
chairs and large observation cockpit
nished as Club Compartment suitable for cards, special
Writing Room or Lounge.
Dainty buffet lunches can be served.
Ample accommodations for personal baggage provided.
The open cockpit boat has a seating capacity for four
or ave people.
